abstract.p: Karin J Lauria letter on March 30 article on hotels that cater to guests with dogs

block.p: To the Editor: ''No Pet Left Behind'' (March 30) notes that the Gansevoort South in Miami Beach will provide pets with ''a bed mat of 100 percent Egyptian cotton embroidered with the dog's name.'' Last year, I spent over $400 to buy my labs new beds, which, I explained to them, are the Cadillacs of dog beds. Still, one prefers the old couch, and the other likes to lie against the front door where his back can catch the draft. I suspect they would be unimpressed by 100 percent Egyptian cotton.
